name: Life Is A Game
description:
16-bit side-scroller print inspired by Battle Royale and in the style of Sailor Moon Bishoujo Senshi arcade game. An edition of #42 for Gallery 1988’s Crazy 4 Cult 7 show in NYC opening Friday 13th December, 2013. I have a limited number of Artist's Prints for sale.
  • Medium: Giclée print
  • Stock: Innova IFA14 Smooth Cotton High White 315gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 5, signed

name: Baby Makin' Music (Variant)
description:
Screen printed jazz club poster promoting a night of majestic jazz with San Diego legend, Ron Burgundy. This is a variant of the sold out print I did for the Judd Apatow Tribute Show at Gallery 1988, Melrose in 2012. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 3 colour screen print
  • Stock: Colorplan 'Natural' 350 gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: TBA

name: Bank Robbery Bear
description:
It's not just an ingenious disguise - this Black Bear is putting the frame on his Panda cousin. Bears involved in organised crime are legendary for their ruthlessness, however, their heavy claws and lack of opposable thumbs mean they do struggle to operate a firearm. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes. Screen printed to perfection by Luma Studio.
  • Medium: 3 colour screen print
  • Stock: Fedrigoni Woodstock Verde 285gsm
  • Dimensions: 12" x 16"
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: n/a

name: The Horde
description:
This print is an homage to a bunch of different zombie-related influences including Evil Dead, Night of The Living Dead, Left 4 Dead, The Walking Dead, Shaun of the Dead and other things with 'Dead' in the title. Featuring Philip's 1986 Jaguar Sovereign V12 (Series III), and see if you can spot a certain undead 80s pop music star. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 4 colour screen print
  • Stock: Black stock 240gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 200, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: n/a

name: The Deadliest Sharks of All Time
description:
Screen printed public information poster detailing the relative scale of the deadliest sharks of all time complete with their Latin binomial nomenclature, for science. Many of these magnificent creatures are still being deadly in our oceans today, so it's important to know what you're up against when you are surfing, swimming, snorkelling or doing seal impressions in shark infested waters. Also included is the now extinct, ancient Megalodon shark which was the subject of a 2002 film by the same name as well as several hilarious, and much loved sequels. It's also a t-shirt at Threadless! This print sold out at Gallery 1988 but I recently found a few APs and they are available to buy now. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 2 colour screen print
  • Stock: White stock 240gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 100, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: n/a

name: Baby Makin' Music
description:
Screen printed jazz club poster promoting a night of majestic jazz with San Diego legend, Ron Burgundy. For the Judd Apatow Tribute Show at Gallery 1988, Melrose in December 2012. I have a handful of prints left. There are a few of the numbered edition of 50 and a couple of APs. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 3 colour screen print
  • Stock: Ivory 350gsm uncoated
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 4, signed

name: Pint Break
description:
More Hot Fuzz 16-bit fun for Gallery 1988's The Official Edgar Wright Art Show, which opens August 20 and remains on display though September 7. Point Break is one of Danny Butterman's favourite films and he had long fantasized about firing his gun into the air while shouting 'AAARGH!'. This is what happens when emotions get too high. I ship from the UK, so for those who would prefer to buy from the US, Gallery 1988 may have a few remaining in stock. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: Giclée print
  • Stock: Photo Rag stock, approx 300gsm
  • Dimensions: 12 x 12 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 40, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 8, signed

name: The Greater Good
description:
Hot Fuzz meets Final Fight for Gallery 1988's The Official Edgar Wright Art Show, which opens August 20 and remains on display though September 7. Featuring Sergeant Nicholas Angle (sic.) and PC Danny Butterman as 16-bit game sprites duelling with Sandford locals in a classic side-scroller. This is a sequel to my Shaun of The Dead print Player 2 Has Entered The Game from the 2012 Crazy 4 Cult: New York gallery show. I ship from the UK, so for those who would prefer to buy from the US, Gallery 1988 may have a few remaining in stock. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: Giclée print
  • Stock: Photo Rag stock, approx 300gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 100, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 8, signed

name: Hand-Held Heroes
description:
In 1990 I got a Game Boy for Christmas. It was the first games console I ever owned and it was my most prized possession. I was having a think about what to do for the ‘iam8bit Entertainment System‘ gallery show, and I thought it would be cool to pay tribute to that little green screen that gave me my start in console gaming. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes. Expect a few flecks and imperfections because of the nature of the screen print process.
  • Medium: 3 colour screen print
  • Stock: Colorplan Pistachio green stock
  • Dimensions: 12" x 16"
  • Edition: 100, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 4, signed

name: Gatsby
description:
A two colour screen print celebrating a Great American Novel, The Great Gatsby. White and black inks screened onto Colourplan Citrine 270gsm stock. Prints are unframed. They will be shipped in sturdy flat packaging. For bulk orders of 5 or more prints, please contact me to discuss shipping options.
  • Medium: 2 colour screen print
  • Stock: Colourplan Citrine 270gsm
  • Dimensions: A4 sized, 297 x 210 mm (11.7 x 8.3 in)
  • Edition: 250, numbered and signed

name: The Sword of Destiny
description:
A screen print for the Gallery 1988 Arrested Development art show in 2012. AD is one of my favourite shows ever and when it comes to picking a starting point for an art piece, it offers an embarrassment of riches. In the end, I did a poster for my favourite episode: 'Sword of Destiny'. Apart from being brilliantly funny (with cameos from Dan Castellaneta and Ben Stiller) it's a great episode because the writers use plot devices and double-entendres from the go to take a side-swipe at FOX for reducing and re-scheduling the show (before ultimately cancelling it). I attempted to make my print a continuation of that. If you haven't seen the show then watch all 3 seasons on Netflix. If you have seen it, then watch this episode again. This print sold out at Gallery 1988 but I recently found a few APs and they are available to buy now. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 2 colour screen print
  • Stock: Sirio 240gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 30, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 3, signed

name: Player 2 Has Entered The Game
description:
Shaun of the Dead meets Streets of Rage for Gallery 1988's Crazy 4 Cult: New York, an art show featuring classic cult movie inspired artwork, held in NYC in August and September 2012. Featuring Shaun and Ed as 16-bit game sprites fighting zombies in a classic side-scroller. Props and references from the movie abound. It is due to appear in the next instalment of the popular 'Crazy 4 Cult' book from Titan. This print SOLD OUT at Gallery 1988, but I have a SUPER limited number of APs (Artist's Prints) in my shop. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: Giclée print
  • Stock: Innova IFA14 Smooth Cotton High White 315gsm
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 5, signed

name: I Am The Danger
description:
A screen print for The Breaking Bad Art Project show at Gallery 1988 celebrating the beginning of the final season in August 2012. Artwork inspired by the greatest show on TV right now. I held back a few APs (Artist's Prints) in the UK. All 10 are signed. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 2 colour screen print
  • Stock: Black stock
  • Dimensions: 16" x 16” (407 x 407mm)
  • Edition:50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 10, signed

name: Room 237
description:
My Room 237 poster for Mondo. Room 237 is a documentary film that explores themes and hidden meanings in Stanley Kubrick’s The Shining. For this poster I thought it would be fun to weave some of the themes of the film into the artwork in a way that reflected the essence of the film. There's a dozen or so disguised symbols in the artwork. Some more obvious than others. The edition sold by Mondo was 175 and those were hand numbered but not signed. The edition is SOLD OUT. The prints for sale here are some of the 25 APs (Artists Prints) that I have signed. Please note: Some elements of the artwork were lost by the printer during the complicated preparation of the screens - including the footprints and Kubrick's face in the moon. This effected all prints in the edition and the APs. I personally think that this makes it rare and desirable like The Inverted Jenny. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 5 colour screen print
  • Stock: 250gsm white
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition:175, hand-numbered, signed
  • Artist's Prints: 25, signed

name: The Meaning of Life
description:
Giclée print on Photo Rag, 308gsm. This stock is a much whiter, smoother surface and lends itself particularly well to black and white and colour reproductions, and has a 100% rag content. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: Giclée print
  • Stock: Photo Rag, 308gsm
  • Dimensions: A2 sized, 420 x 594 mm (16.5 x 23.4 in)
  • Edition: 200, numbered and signed on reverse

name: Quality To The Core
description:
Screen printed vintage cigarette ad poster for Quentin Tarantino’s fictional cigarette brand ‘Red Apple’for the Product Placement Show at Gallery 1988, Melrose in March 2013. Most of the prints are available from Gallery 1988's website store after the show opens. but I will have a few to sell from the UK at some point. Not many though. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 4 colour screen print
  • Stock: 350gsm Sirio
  • Dimensions: 24 x 18 in (610 x 458 mm)
  • Edition: 75, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 25, signed

name: You Eediots!!
description:
Ren and Stimpy was one of my favourite shows as a kid so when iam8bit invited me to take part in the Nickelodeon ‘It’s the shizNICK!’ art show, there was only really one thing on my mind. It’s an homage to a particular Ren & Stimpy episode called ‘Svën Höek’. Ren’s cousin Svën comes to stay and Ren is excited about hosting an educated, cultured Höek family member to give him some reprieve from the imbecilic Stimpy. To Ren’s dejection, cousin Svën is on an intellectual par with Stimpy and the pair of simpletons soon become good friends. This print is inspired by the scene when Ren returns home to find his house and his treasured belongings trashed by the new companions. Fury ensues! Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes. Expect a few flecks and imperfections because of the nature of the screen print process.
  • Medium: 2 colour screen print
  • Stock: Black stock approx 220gsm
  • Dimensions: 12" x 16"
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 5, signed

name: Sky Rockets in Flight
description:
This is a print for the SPACE! Gallery show at Gallery 1988 in L.A. It features all of the significant rockets involved in space flight and their occupants. From Fruit Flies to the first commercial flight a few years ago it's a really interesting evolution. All of the rockets and pixel passengers are to scale so it gives you an idea of the growth in power over the decades from the German V2 rocket which was originally designed as a weapon to attack London during World War II, right through to the incredible Saturn rocket used in the Apollo space program. It's a numbered giclee print. Edition of just 30 and I'll have a few signed APs in the UK. The show opens 21 June at the Gallery 1988 West location with an opening reception from 7pm-10pm. Prints are sold unframed.
  • Medium: Giclée print
  • Stock: Photo Rag
  • Dimensions: 24" x 18"
  • Edition: 30, numbered
  • Artist's Prints 5, signed

name: Ratchet & Clank 10th Anniversary
description:
A limited edition screen print sanctioned organised by iam8bit and officially sanctioned by Insomniac Games and Playstation. Celebrating 10 years of Playstation's most enigmatic couple. The edition sold by iam8bit was 300 and those were hand numbered but not signed. The edition is SOLD OUT. The prints for sale here are some of the 3 APs (Artists Prints) that I have signed. The prints are unframed.
  • Medium: 6 colour screen print
  • Stock: 350gsm uncoated
  • Dimensions: 19 x 29 in (488 x 737 mm)
  • Edition: 300, numbered
  • Artist's Prints: 6, signed

name: It Came Out of Nowhere
description:
A screen print inspired by two titans of sci-fi; Doctor Who and Back To The Future. It Came Out of Nowhere remains one of the best selling t-shirts at shirt.woot since it first appeared there in 2009. I wanted to make a limited edition screen print for the iam8bit ‘So You Created A Wormhole’ time-travel art show, so this was produced with special dispensation from the big-wigs at woot and printed to perfection by Bob Eight Pop in London. That shirt is still available to all nerds at shirt.woot. I held back a bunch of prints in the UK. iam8bit have prints in stock for US residents. There are several of the numbered edition of 88 and a couple of APs - all are signed. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 6 colour screen print
  • Stock: White Colorplan 350gsm
  • Dimensions: A2 sized, 420 x 594 mm (16.5 x 23.4 in)
  • Edition: 88, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 25, signed

name: Not Sure If Art
description:
Exploring the ‘Not Sure If‘ meme (explained) using the cynical face of Philip J. Fry. A clever commentary on the nature of appropriation and copyright in the Internet age, I’m sure you’ll agree. Lovingly hand-made in London, England for the “Memes” group show featuring over 100 artists at Gallery 1988, Melrose, Los Angeles. Gallery 1988 have prints in stock for US residents. I have a handful of prints left. There are a few of the numbered edition of 50 and a couple of APs - all are signed. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 5 colour screen print
  • Stock: Sirio 350gsm
  • Dimensions: A3 size, 297 x 420 mm (11.7 x 16.5 in)
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 10, signed

name: First World Problems
description:
Liechtenstein style emotional woman inspired by the ‘First World Problems‘ meme. Lovingly hand-made in London, England for the “Memes” group show featuring over 100 artists at Gallery 1988, Melrose, Los Angeles. Gallery 1988 have prints in stock for US residents. I have a handful of prints left. There are a few of the numbered edition of 50 and a couple of APs - all are signed. Prints are unframed. They will be rolled in acid-free tissue paper and and shipped in super strong postal tubes.
  • Medium: 4 colour screen print
  • Stock: Sirio 350gsm
  • Dimensions: A2 sized, 420 x 594 mm (16.5 x 23.4 in)
  • Edition: 50, numbered and signed
  • Artist's Prints: 6, signed

name: Toy Stories Greetings Cards, Pack 1
description:
A selection pack of 3 of my Toy Stories greetings cards published by Noi in the UK. Each card typically retails at £2.50 in the stores so you can see how this is an offer you probably shouldn't refuse. Blank inside. Each card comes wrapped in protective cellophane and is accompanied by an envelope that fits just right.
Included in Pack 1:
  • Divas
  • Agent Provocateur
  • You Used To Be Cool

name: Toy Confidential
description: Toy Confidential: The Secret Life of Snarky Toys is a collection of 100 Toy Stories published by How Books. Original images of plastic toys interacting in unusual ways including conceited unicorns and dinosaurs, ponies that looked bigger on eBay, Lassie negotiating for a bigger bed, a sad pinata and pugs snorting cocaine. The pages of the book are perforated so the images can be torn out and displayed or shared with friends and frenemies. For more information on the book and on the Toy Stories project check out the Toy Confidential website or the dedicated Facebook page. I've got a number of copies of the book without perforated pages if you'd prefer to have them fixed. Just specify which you'd prefer in the drop-down menu. Available signed by the author!
